content.heading: Create an Array
copy: The JavaScript Array object is a global object that is used to construct arrays; which are high-level, list-like objects. Arrays are used to store multiple values in a single variable.
An array can hold many values under a single name that can be accessed using an index number.

The typeof operator in JavaScript returns 'object' for arrays. Arrays use numbers (indexes) to access elements. Objects use names (key/value pairs) to access it's 'members'. In JavaScript, it is best to describe arrays as arrays and not objects.
